applicationPreparationPage.explanation: Below is a list of what you will need to bring to a DMV office in order to complete your application.

ending.callCenterDetails: Call Center business hours are: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday 8 am to 5 pm, and Wednesday, 9am to 5pm

identity.body:
All applicants need to prove their identity, true full name (first, middle, last ) and date of birth.

You will need to bring original versions of these documents, as photocopies and laminated versions are not accepted.

See the DMV’s list of acceptable identity documents.

If the name on your identity document is different from the name you provided on your application, you must submit a name change document that establishes your true full name.

socialSecurity.body:
You are required to provide your Social Security Number to the DMV.

If you changed your name, make sure that change is updated with the Social Security Administration prior to your visit.

californiaResidency.body: You will need to bring in 1 document that proves that you live in California. This document should show the address where you want your card mailed. This address will also appear on the front of your card. Please review our list of acceptable California Residency documents.

realIdSection.pleaseSeeDocs: Please view the Real ID Document PDF for a list of acceptable documents for these 3 categories.

veteransSection.body: To get a Veteran Designation on your card, you need to submit a completed Veteran Status Verification Form (VSD- 001). You can obtain a VSD-001 from your County Veteran Service Office. We thank you for your service!

body.needListHeader: In order to get a provisional driving permit we will need to see  1 of the following:
needListItems: Certificate of Completion of California Driver Education (classroom) or
Certificate of Completion of California Driver Education and Driver Training or
Certificate of Enrollment in a California Integrated Driver Education and Driver Training Program.
body.provisionalExplanation: You will need to apply for a provisional driving permit.
body.knowledgeTest: You will need to take a knowledge test.
body.testAdvice: We recommend studying the California Driver handbook and trying some practice exams in advance of your visit.

FAQHaveAnotherState.title: Already have a permit or training certificate in another state?

body.proofListHeader: You will need to bring 1 of the following:
proofListItems: Proof that you completed a Driver Education/Training course that is equivalent to a California secondary school course.
A completed DL 33 form. Obtain this form from your local DMV office or by calling DMV at 1-800-777-0133. Send the DL 33 form to your out-of-state secondary school to complete.
body.requirementsLink: Review the Driver Education and Driver Training Form Requirements for more information.
body.juniorPermitNote: Please note that as a minor, we cannot directly transfer driver licenses that state "probationary", "provisional", or "junior", driving permits, or accept training certificates from out of state.

body.openingExplanation: We see that you may have had a driver license from another state. California's laws for teen drivers between 16 and 18 years of age may be different than those in other states.
body.knowledgeTest: As a new driver in California, you will need to pass a knowledge test.
body.juniorPermitNote: As a minor, we cannot transfer any driver license from a different state if your driver license says "probationary", "provisional", or "junior".
body.provisionalProcess: Drivers under 18 years of age in California must first apply for a provisional permit. After six months you will be eligible to get a provisional driver license.

FAQWillIneedToTakeTest.title: Will I need to take the drive test?
FAQWillIneedToTakeTest.listHeader: We can only waive your drive test if you:
listItems: Currently hold a driver license from a state outside of California and
Successfully completed a driving skills course in a qualifying secondary school and

body.explanation: As a new driver in California, you will need to pass a knowledge test.
body.permitProcess: Once you pass the knowledge test, you will get a permit. You then need to take your drive test.
body.waiverCanProcess: We can only waive your drive test if: you have been previously licensed.
body.waiverMayProcess: We may waive your drive test if: you have a valid driver license in another state.

body.explanation: To receive a motorcycle or scooter license, you need to pass the motorcycle knowledge test. Please review the California Motorcycle handbook.
body.waiverProcess: We may waive your drive test if: you have a Certificate of Completion of Motorcycle Training (DL 389) form from the CHP’s California Motorcyclist Safety Program . The course instructor will provide this form upon successful completion of the course.

body.under21Message: Because you are under 21 you must have a Certificate of Completion of Motorcycle Training (DL 389) form from the CHP’s California Motorcyclist Safety Program prior to visiting DMV. The course instructor will provide this form upon successful completion of the course.
body.onCompletion: Once you have completed the course, you must hold your permit for 6 months prior to obtaining your license.

body.waiverProcess: We may waive your drive test if: you have a valid motorcycle license in another state or you have a Certificate of Completion of Motorcycle Training (DL 389) form from the CHP’s California Motorcyclist Safety Program.

additionalMotorcycleTestingSection.body: In California, to receive a motorcycle or scooter license, you need to pass the basic driver license knowledge test. We recommend studying the California Driver handbook and trying some practice exams in advance of your visit.

body.healthQuestionnaire: In order to get a Non-Commercial Class A permit, you need to submit a valid Health Questionnaire (DL 546).
body.knowledgeTest: The Recreational Vehicles and Non-Commercial Class A Trailers knowledge test is also required. We recommend studying California's RV & Trailers handbook in advance of your exam.
body.afterPassingExam: Once you pass the exams, you will be issued a permit. The DMV website provides information on what’s needed to get your full license.

body.healthQuestionnaire: In order to get a Non-Commercial Class B permit, you need to submit a valid Health Questionnaire (DL 546A) signed by your physician.
body.houseCarTest: The 45' Housecar knowledge test is also required. We recommend studying California's RV & Trailers handbook in advance of your exam.

body.testRequirements: To get a Firefighter endorsement you will need to take and pass the Firefighter endorsement knowledge test.
body.otherRequirements: You will also need to submit a valid Health Questionnaire (DL 546) and an Original Firefighter Employment and Training Verification letter that meets the following criteria:
otherRequirementsValues: Certifies current employment as a firefighter or proof of registration as a volunteer firefighter
Certifies completion of fire equipment operator training
Signed by fire chief or designee

sexChangeSection.body:
In order to make this change, you must bring a Medical Certification and Authorization Form (DL 329) that has been completed and signed by your physician or psychologist.

You’ll also need to bring your name change document that has your true full name (first, middle, last) both before and after your name change.

nameChangeSection.body:
In order to reflect your name change on your card(s), you must first change your name at your local Social Security Administration office.

You’ll also need to bring your name change document that has your true full name (first, middle, last) both before and after your name change.

reducedFeeSection.body: Finally, we’ll need the Reduced Fee Identification Card Eligibility Verification (DL 389) form. DMV does not provide this form. If you get assistance through the government or a nonprofit, speak with them about getting a form.

noFeeSection.body: Finally, we’ll need the No Fee Identification Card Eligibility Verification (DL 933) form. DMV does not provide this form. If you get assistance through the government or a nonprofit, speak with them about getting a form.

FAQdontKnowIfIneedCommercial.title: I don’t know if I need a commercial driver license

youWillNeedIf.header: You will need a CDL if you plan to operate a vehicle that:
values: Has a gross vehicle weight rating (GVWR) of 26,001+ pounds.
Is designed, used, or maintained for carrying more than 10 persons, including the driver.
Tows a vehicle or trailer which has a GVWR of 10,001+ pounds.
Transports hazardous materials which require placards.
Tows any combination of two trailers or a vehicle and trailer.

youWontNeedIf.header: You will not need a CDL if you only expect to drive:
values: Recreational vehicles (5th wheel travel trailers and motor homes)
Class C agricultural hazardous materials transporters.
Department of Defense employees who are in uniform and driving Department of Defense vehicles.

body.seeDMV: Detailed information is available at dmv.ca.gov

whatYouCanDoItems: Apply for a driver license or ID card.
whatYouCanDoPage.requiredDocuments: After you submit this application, we will give you a list of required documents. You must go to a DMV office with these documents to finish your application.

doNotUseIf.header: Do not use this application if:
values: You do not have an email address and phone number. These are required to fill this out from home.q`
You are in a confidential address program or in Safe at Home.
doNotUseIf.instead: Instead, make an appointment to visit your local DMV office.

values: You do not have an email address and phone number. These are required to fill this out from home.
You only want an Ambulance, VTT, or HAM certificate for your CDL.
You are in a confidential address program or in Safe at Home.

FAQDoSomethingElse.title: I need to do something else

listItems: Get copies of your driving record
body.instead: Visit the DMV website to do these tasks.

idMePage.prompt: The DMV is working with ID.me to protect your digital identity.
idMePage.buttonSignIn: Sign in with an ID.me account
idMePage.emailRequired: An email address and phone number are required. Please visit a DMV office if you do not want to make an ID.me account
idMePage.legalIdentity: ID.me allows you to prove your legal identity. The DMV of California has partnered with ID.me to ensure that your personal information is accurate and secure.
idMePage.dmvPartnering: The DMV of California chose to partner with ID.me because it has met rigorous requirements for security and identity-proofing.
idMePage.learnMore: For more information, please visit ID.me.

idMeReturnPage.youCanStartNewApp: You can also start a new application.
idMeReturnPage.applyingBoth: Applying for a driver license and an ID card
idMeReturnPage.applyingCDL: Applying for a commercial driver license

idMeNoAuthPage.prompt: We aren’t able to access your account.
idMeNoAuthPage.comeToDMVoffice: If you can't sign in or don't want to use ID.me, you will need to complete this application at a DMV field office. Make an appointment for faster service.

dateOfBirthPage.under21Message: Applicants under 21 years of age are not allowed to engage in interstate commerce or transport hazardous materials.

values: Get a California CDL for the first time

currentCardInformationPage.prompt: If you know it, please enter your California CDL number.
currentCardInformationPage.explanation: Your number can be found at the top of your commercial driver license, starting with a letter.

correctOrUpdatePage.explanation: You cannot update your medical certificate through this form.

californiaResidentPage.prompt: Are you a resident of California?

infoMessageNo.header: We’re sorry, but you do not qualify for a California CDL at this time.
infoMessageNo.explanation: You must be a California resident to apply.

addressPage.doYouGetMailingHereExplanation: The DMV will print your mailing address on your CDL. The CDL will also be sent to your mailing address.

noMessage.header: We're sorry, but you do not qualify for a California CDL at this time.
noMessage.explanation: Commercial Drivers must have a Social Security Number and are required to provide proof upon application. Both US citizens and non-citizen residents with legal presence are eligible to receive a Social Security Number. Contact the Social Security Administration for more information.

caDlPage.prompt: Do you currently have a California driver license?
caDlPage.noMessage: In order to get your Commercial Learner’s Permit, you’ll need to first pass the knowledge and driving skills tests for a basic (Non-Commercial Class C) driver license.

yesSection.prompt: Please tell us about your most recent driver license.
yesSection.explanation: We'll ask for a complete license history later in the application.
yesSection.messageBody: In order to get your Commercial Learner's Permit (CLP), you'll need to obtain a California Non-Commercial Class C driver license.  To do this, you will need to pass the Non-Commercial Class C knowledge test.

expiredMessage.header: We see your driver license is expired.

nonCaliforniaMessage.header: We see your driver license isn’t from California.

licenseClassPage.prompt: What class of commercial driver license do you need?

driveItems: Any legal combination of vehicles, including vehicles under Class B and Class C
towItems: All vehicles a Class B and a Class C licensed driver may tow
Any single vehicle with a GVWR of more than 10,000 pounds
Any trailer bus, with endorsement OR more than 1 vehicle, with endorsement

FAQNotSureWhatClass.title: I'm not sure which class I need

driveItems: Any 2-axle vehicle with a GVWR of 26,000 pounds or less, or any 3-axle vehicle weighing 6,000 pounds gross or less, carrying hazardous materials (HazMat) requiring placards.  This requires a HazMat endorsement.
Any bus or passenger vehicle with a GVWR of 26,000 pounds or less, designed, used, or maintained to carry more than 10 persons, including the driver. This requires a passenger endorsement.
Any vehicle allowed under a Non-Commercial Class C license.
classC.explanation: You may tow all vehicles allowed under the Non-Commercial Class C driver license.

driveItems: All vehicles a Commercial Class C licensed driver may drive.
A bus (except a trailer bus). This requires a passenger endorsement.
Any farm labor vehicle, with endorsement
towItems: A single vehicle with a GVWR of 10,000 pounds or less
All vehicles a Commercial Class C licensed driver may tow

endorsmentsPage.prompt: Do you need any endorsements on your CDL?

values.H: Marked vehicles transporting hazardous materials or wastes
values.X: Tank vehicles transporting hazardous materials or wastes

certificationSection.prompt: Do you need a professional certificate from the DMV?

certifications.prompt: You can request the following certificates at a DMV field office:

FAQMissingCertifications.title: I need a certificate I don’t see here

body.header: The California Highway Patrol (CHP) is responsible for issuing the following professional certificates:

classCAddition.passengerVehicle: The Verification of Transit Testing certificate requires a Passenger Vehicle endorsement.
classCAddition.fullEndorsment: Full class, endorsement, and certificate descriptions requirements are available in California’s Commercial Driver Handbook.

body.header: You need an endorsement if you plan to operate a commercial motor vehicle that is:
listItems: Carrying more than 10 persons, including the driver.
Towing more than one vehicle or trailer.
body.explanation: Full class, endorsement, and certificate descriptions and requirements are available in California’s Commercial Driver Handbook.

motorcyclePage.prompt: Do you need a motorcycle (Class M) on your CDL?

startHerePage.motorcycleSentence: You also want to drive a motorcycle/scooter
startHerePage.realID: Your CDL will be REAL ID compliant.

fillOutNewApplication.update: In order to update your CDL, you’re going to need to fill out a new application.

startHerePage.timeStatement:
It takes around 10 minutes to complete.

Once you’re done, you will need to visit your local DMV office.

nextSteps.title: Here's what happens next:
steps: You will get this confirmation code emailed to you.
You need to go to your local DMV office to finalize your application.
Prepare for your visit by collecting the required documents and studying for your knowledge test(s). We’ve created a custom preparation list based on the information you provided in your application.
At the DMV field office, show the employee your confirmation number and documents. They will bring up your application.
You will be asked to verify your information. You will then certify that it's correct during your DMV field office visit.

confirmationPage.registrationCompleteAtOffice: As a reminder, your voter registration application will be processed when you complete your application at the DMV field office.
confirmationPage.registerSooner: If you need to register to vote before your DMV visit: You can register online at RegisterToVote.ca.gov.
confirmationPage.register30days: If you would like to vote in the next statewide election register online now at RegisterToVote.ca.gov.
confirmationPage.avoidLines: To avoid long waits and lines, make an appointment at your local DMV now.

confirmationCDL.commercialLearnersPermit: Should you pass your knowledge tests and fulfill all other requirements, you will be issued a Commercial Learner's Permit (CLP). There is a mandatory waiting period of 14 days between when your CLP is issued and when you will become eligible to receive a temporary Commercial Driver License.

switchLanguagePage.prompt: Please select a language to use for this application.

namePage.explanation: This is the name that appears on official identity documents like your birth certificate and passport.

wdywtdtPage.prompt: What would you like to do today?
wdywtdtPage.explanation: Pick one option for now. You can add another option later in the application.
values: Get a card for the first time

prompt.id: Do you plan on using your ID to fly?
prompt.license: Do you plan on using your Driver License to fly?
prompt.card: Do you plan on using your card to fly?

realIdPage.explanation: As of October 1, 2020, you will need a REAL ID compliant driver license or ID card to fly within the United States.

FAQWhatIsRealID.title: What's a REAL ID compliant card?
FAQWhatIsRealID.body:
To meet the REAL ID Act, the California DMV will offer two types of cards: a REAL ID compliant card and a federal non-compliant card. Both a REAL ID compliant and a federal non-compliant driver license allow you to legally drive.

You need a REAL ID compliant card in order to fly within the U.S or to enter military bases and most federal facilities starting October 1, 2020.

Otherwise, you will need a passport or other document accepted by the Transportation Security Administration and the Department of Homeland Security.

FAQWhatIsRequiredForRealID.title: What's required to get a REAL ID compliant card?

body.header: You will need 1 of the following:
items: Valid, unexpired U.S. passport or passport card
U.S. Certificate or Consular Report of Birth Abroad
Unexpired foreign passport with valid U.S. visa and approved I-94 form
Certified copy of Birth certificate from a U.S. Territory
Unexpired employment authorization document (EAD) Card (I-766) or valid/expired EAD Card with Notice of Action (I-797 C)
body.otherRequirements: You also need one document that proves you live in California and one document with your Social Security Number such as your Social Security card or Internal Revenue Service form (e.g., W2, 1099, or 1040).

prompt.renew: What type of card are you renewing?
prompt.replace: What type of card are you replacing?
prompt.correctOrUpdate: What type of card are you correcting or updating?

seniorIdPage.prompt: Would you like to get a free Senior Identification Card
seniorIdPage.explanation: If you do not want "Senior Identification Card", you will have to pay the normal fee.

reducedFeePage.prompt: Are you applying for a reduced fee or free ID?
reducedFeePage.licenseExplanation: This only applies to your ID Card. You cannot get a free or reduced fee driver license.

rightFormsSection.prompt: Do you have the right form?
rightFormsSection.explanation: In order to get a reduced fee ID you need to have the Reduced Fee Identification Card Eligibility Verification form (DL 937). To get a free ID you need to have No Fee Identification Card Eligibility Verification (DL 933) form.

FAQHowToGetForms.title: How do I get these forms?
FAQHowToGetForms.body: The DMV does not provide these forms. If you get assistance through the government or a non-profit, speak with them about getting a form.

endorsementsSection.explanation: If you only want an ambulance certificate, please visit a DMV field office.

medical.title: Medical information
medical.body: The following conditions that may affect your ability to operate a motor vehicle safely include, but are not limited to: loss of consciousness; episode of marked confusion caused by any condition which may bring about recurring lapses; disease, disorder, or disability (examples of these are epilepsy, diabetes, stroke, cataracts, Parkinson’s disease); decrease or change in your vision due to cataracts, macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy, glaucoma, retinitis pigmentosa, or other progressive condition; health problems because of alcohol or drug abuse.

veteran.title: Veteran statement
veteran.body: By marking the veteran box on this application, I certify that I am a veteran of the United States Armed Forces and that I want to receive veteran benefits information from the California Department of Veterans A airs (CalVet). By marking the veteran box on this application, I also consent to DMV transmitting my name and mailing address to CalVet for this purpose only, and I certify that I have been notified that this transmittal will occur.

organDonation.title: Organ donation statement
organDonation.body: If you marked ‘Yes’ to register as an organ and tissue donor, you are legally authorizing the recovery of organs and tissues in the event of your death. Registering as a donor will not a ect your medical treatment in any way. As outlined in the California Anatomical Gift Act, your authorization is legally binding and, unless the donor is under 18 years of age, your decision does not require the consent of any other person. For registered donors under 18 years of age, the legal guardian shall make the  nal donation decision. You may limit your donation to speci c organs or tissues, place usage restrictions (for example transplantation or research), obtain more information about donation, or remove your name from the registry on the website of Donate Life California: www.donateLIFEcalifornia.org. By registering as an Organ Donor, you are giving your consent to allow DMV to electronically transmit your true full name, residence or mailing address, year of birth, and California driver license or identi cation card number to Donate Life California. By signing this form, you consent to this process and have been notified that this transmittal will occur.

voterRegistration.title: Voter registration
bodyBullets: If sharing your address could put you in life-threatening danger, you may be eligible to register to vote confidentially. For more information, contact the Safe at Home program at (877) 322-5227 or visit www.sos.ca.gov/safeathome/.

For U.S. citizens only. If you indicate that you are eligible to vote, the DMV will send all of the voter registration information collected on this form, including your digital signature, to the Secretary of State. The o ce where you registered will remain con dential and will be used only for voter registration purposes.

If you are eligible to vote and decline to register to vote, your decision will remain con dential; however this information will be sent to the Secretary of State to be used only for voter outreach and registration purposes.
Voter registration information provided on this application is con dential. The DMV does not make voter eligibility determinations.
If you have not received voter registration information within 30 days of registering, contact your county elections o cial or the Secretary of State.
Please visit voterstatus.sos.ca.gov/ for more information about your voter registration or www.sos.ca.gov for general information.

criminalProsecution.title: Criminal prosecution
bodyBullets: If you submit fraudulent information, the DMV may pursue criminal prosecution.
Any person who uses false documents to conceal their true citizenship or resident alien status is guilty of a felony pursuant to California Penal Code §114.

financialResponsibility.title: Financial responsibility
bodyBullets: Financial responsibility (commonly known as insurance) is required on all vehicles operated or parked on California roadways. You must carry evidence of financial responsibility in your vehicle at all times and it must be provided when: requested by law enforcement, renewing vehicle registration, the vehicle is involved in a traffic collision.

If you cannot afford liability insurance, you may be eligible for the California Low Cost Automobile Insurance Program. Additional information is available at www.mylowcostauto.com or by calling (866) 602-8861.

paymentRefunds.title: Payments / Refunds
bodyBullets: Visit www.dmv.ca.gov to review payment options at your local DMV field office. If you are mailing your renewal, payment must be by check. (Checks should be payable to DMV).
Once this application form and fee have been submitted, no refunds will be made.

privacy.title: Privacy notice
bodyBullets: DMV uses the information on this form to determine your eligibility for a Driver License or Identification Card and for the administration of driver license laws.

Information provided to DMV on this form is collected and subject to the limitations in the Information Practices Act (Civil Code 1798 et seq.), the Driver’s Privacy Protection Act (18 U.S.C. 2721-2725), the California Vehicle Code (CVC) and other applicable state and federal laws and regulations.
DMV verifies the information and documents you provide with other governmental agencies.

All information on this form is mandatory except where noted. DMV may deny your application for not providing the required information. Failure to provide the information required on this form is cause for refusal to issue a driver license or identi cation card, or, in some cases, cancellation or withdrawal of the driving privilege.

DMV shares your information with other governmental agencies, law enforcement, and commercial entities as authorized by law. You may obtain a copy of your record at www.dmv.ca.gov or at any DMV field office during regular office hours. For assistance with access to your record, call (800) 777-0133 or make an appointment to visit a DMV field office during regular business hours. For assistance with corrections to your record, contact DMV’s Licensing Operations Division Mandatory Actions Unit at (916) 657-6525.
Questions regarding your Driver License or Identification Card should be addressed to: Driver License Inquiries, Department of Motor Vehicles, PO Box 942890, Sacramento, CA 94290-0001.

For more information regarding specific CVC Sections or how DMV shares your information, please visit www.dmv.ca.gov. You may also request a copy of How Your DMV Information is Shared (FFDMV 17) Fast Facts brochure from any field office.
DMV’s Privacy Policy is located at www.dmv.ca.gov under the 'Privacy Policy' link at the bottom of the page.
Questions regarding this notice should be addressed to: Department of Motor Vehicles, ATTN: Chief Privacy Officer – MS F127, PO Box 932328, Sacramento, CA 94232-3280.

certifications.title: Certifications
bodyBullets: I agree to submit to a chemical test of my blood, breath, or urine for the purpose of determining the alcohol or drug content of my blood when testing is requested by a peace o cer acting in accordance with California Vehicle Code (CVC) §23612.

I am hereby advised that being under the in uence of alcohol or drugs, or both, impairs the ability to safely operate a motor vehicle. Therefore, it is extremely dangerous to human life to drive while under the in uence of alcohol or drugs, or both. If I drive while under the in uence of alcohol or drugs, or both, and as a result, a person is killed, I can be charged with murder.

By signing this application, I certify that I was notified that if I am under 21 years of age, I cannot legally drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of 0.01% or more. Driving with a BAC of 0.01% or more, or refusing to take, or failing to complete an alcohol screening or drug test, results in a one-year suspension of my driving privilege.

By signing this application, I certify that I was notified that if I am currently on court probation for a driving under the in uence o ense, I cannot legally drive with a BAC of 0.01% or more. Driving with a BAC of 0.01% or more results in a one-year suspension of my driving privilege. Refusing to take, or failing to complete an alcohol screening or chemical test will result in a two to three year suspension/revocation of my driving privilege.

I am the person whose name appears on the front of this form. The mailing address shown is valid, existing, and accurate. I agree to accept service of process at this mailing address according to §§415.20(b), 415.30(a), and 416.90 of the California Code of Civil Procedure.
I understand DMV may add traffic convictions reported by other states or jurisdictions to my driving record that may result in sanctions against my California driving privilege.
By signing this form, I am acknowledging my presence in the United States is authorized under federal law, except as speci ed in CVC §12801.
I understand I may have no more than one driver license in my possession or under my control in accordance with CVC §12511.
By signing this application, I certify that I understand traffic signs and signals in accordance with CVC §12800(h).

ageMessages.notASenior: You are no longer eligible for a free Senior ID card.
ageMessages.preregistration: You will be pre-registered to vote.
ageMessages.cdlAgeRestriction: You must be 18 years or older to apply for a commercial driver license in California.

extras.notRegisteredToVoteMessage: If you select No or Decline to answer, you will not be registered to vote.
extras.confirmationAlsoEmailed: This will also be emailed to you.

addressesPage.explanation: Example: 1234 Main St., Los Angeles, CA 90017
addressesPage.mailingAddressSamePrompt: Do you get mail at this address?

mailingAddressSameExplanation.license: The DMV will print your mailing address on your Driver License. Your Driver License will also be sent to your mailing address.
mailingAddressSameExplanation.ID: The DMV will print your mailing address on your ID. Your ID will also be sent to your mailing address.
mailingAddressSameExplanation.cards: The DMV will print your mailing address on your cards. Your cards will also be sent to your mailing address.

addressesPage.mailingAddressExplanation: Example: PO Box 901, Los Angeles, CA 90017

socialSecurityPage.prompt: Do you have a Social Security Number?
socialSecurityPage.explanation: If you have a Social Security Number you must select Yes.
socialSecurityPage.messageNo:
By answering No, you confirm that a Social Security Number has never been issued to you and you are not presently eligible for a Social Security Number. You understand that pursuant to California Vehicle Code §12801, you must provide your Social Security Number to the Department of Motor Vehicles when one is assigned to you.

Read the disclaimer for more information.

values: Get a driver license for the first time
Correct or update your driver license
Get an ID card for the first time
Correct or update your ID card

realID.whichCard: Which card would you like to fly with?
realID.explanation: Either you license or your ID card can be made federally compliant to fly within the United States, but not both.

underFifteen.title: You must be 15 years old to start an application for a learners permit.
underFifteen.explanation: In exceptional circumstances youth between 14 and 15.5 can get a Junior permit. Visit an office or consult documentation on the DMV website if you feel you might be eligible for a Junior permit.

youthLicense.comeBack: Ok, please come back when you turn 15.

monetaryContribution.explanation: Your donation helps support and promote organ and tissue donation.

eligibilityPage.notSharedWithElectionOfficials: Your response to this question will not be shared with election officials.
eligibilityPage.preRegRequirements: If you don't meet all the requirements, you are not eligible to pre-register to vote.
eligibilityPage.preRegEligible: I am 16 or 17 years old and would like to pre-register to vote.
eligibilityPage.preRegUpToDate: Next we'd like to make sure your voter pre-registration is up to date.

newDesignation.id: Would you like to add the word “Veteran” to your ID for a $5 fee?
newDesignation.license: Would you like to add the word “Veteran” to your Driver License for a $5 fee?

selfCertification.prompt: What type of driving do you need to do?

notSure.title: I'm not sure which applies to me

interstate.title: Interstate Commerce
interstate.explanation: Means trade, traffic, or transportation in the U.S. that is:
values: Between a place in a State and a place outside of such State (including a place outside of the U.S.)
Between two places in the state through another State or a place outside of the U.S.
Between two places in the state as part of trade, traffic, or transportation originating or terminating outside the State or the U.S.

intrastate.title: Intrastate Commerce
intrastate.explanation: Means trade, traffic, or transportation in any state which is not described in the term “interstate commerce.”

expected.title: Expected & Non-Expected Licensing
expected.explanation: Some states issues a commercial driver license that does not require drivers to meet the qualifications outlined in CFR, Title 49 §391. Those drivers are considered “excepted” drivers. California does not issue that kind of license. All drivers licensed by California to drive commercial vehicles are non-excepted drivers.

legalAgreement.title: By continuing with the application you agree to the below:
legalAgreement.agreement: I certify (or declare) under penalty of perjury under the laws of the State of California that the motor vehicle that I am using to take the driving skills test is representative of the type of motor vehicle I expect to operate. I further certify that I am not subject to a disqualification, suspension, revocation, or cancellation as written in Title 49 of the Federal Regulations, Part 383.51, and I do not have a driver license from more than one state or jurisdiction.

medicalHistory.prompt: Please review the information below, then truthfully answer the question at the end of this page.
medicalHistory.explanation: The following conditions that may affect your ability to operate a motor vehicle safely include, but are not limited to:
values: Episode of marked confusion caused by any condition which may bring about recurring lapses
Disease, disorder, or disability (examples of these are epilepsy, diabetes, strokes, cataracts, Parkinson's disease)
Vision changes or decrease due to cataracts, macular degenration, diabetic retinopathy, glaucoma, retinitis pigmentosa, or other progressive condition.
Alcohol, drug abuse, or related health problems.
medicalHistory.medicalConditions: Within the last three years, have you had or experienced any medical conditions that could affect your ability to safely operate a motor vehicle?

nameHistory.prompt: Have you ever applied for a California CDL, driver license, or ID card under a different name?

militaryWaiver.prompt: Will you be seeking a military driving experience CDL waiver?
militaryWaiver.explanation: You must have served within the past year.

veteran.veteranOnCDL: Is “Veteran” printed on your commercial driver license?
veteran.addVeteran: Would you like to add the word “Veteran” on your CDL for a $5 fee?
veteran.keepVeteran: Would you like to keep “Veteran” on your CDL

alerts.dlAlert: If you go to the DMV office to finish your license application before you are 15.5 years old, you can only get a Junior permit. These permits are issued only in exceptional circumstances.
alerts.idAlert: You are eligible to complete your ID application in the office today.

disclaimers.review: Please take a moment to review the following disclaimers:

idMe.prompt: The DMV is partnering with ID.me to protect your digital identity.

whatYouAreDoing.applyNoFeeID: You are applying for a no-fee ID card
whatYouAreDoing.replaceNoFeeID: You are replacing a no-fee ID card

parentGuardianSignaturePage.parentSign: Is your parent/guardian available to sign your application?

summary.noInfo: No information has been entered yet

medicalDocuments.title: Medical Information
medicalDocuments.explanation: If you have a medical condition or disability, DMV may require you to take a driving test. You may also have to provide a statement from your physician regarding your current health condition.

realIdDocuments.title: Real ID birth date, name and legal presence proof
realIdDocuments.explanation: We need to verify your date of birth and what we call your “legal presence”. Documents should use your true full name that you use today or we will need additional documents proving your true full name will be required. See our Real ID information page for details on acceptable date of birth and legal presence documents required to receive a Real ID compliant card.

requiredDocuments.title: From that list we will need either:
values: A single document that proves both your date of birth and legal presence.
Or one document for your date of birth and one document for your legal presence.
requiredDocuments.proof: If you were married or divorced, adopted or have changed your name through the courts, please make sure to also bring proof of the true, full name.

legalPresence.title: Legal presence
legalPresence.explanation: All applicants need to prove their date of birth. Unless you’re AB 60, you need to prove legal presence. Please refer to our AB 60 checklist tool and our date of birth and legal presence list.

socialSecurity.title: Proof of Social Security Number
socialSecurity.explanation:
Under California law, we will need proof of your Social Security Number. Our Social Security documents page lists accepted documents.

If you recently changed your name, make sure that change is reflected on the document you bring.

veteran.title: Proof of veterans service
veteran.explanation: To get “Veteran” on your card, you need to to bring a Veteran Status Verification Form that your County Veteran Service Office can provide to you. We thank you for your service!

confirmation.title: What happens to my voter registration information
confirmation.information: The voter registration will be processed when you finish your application at the DMV.

appointmentPrep.goToDMV: You now need to go to the DMV!
appointmentPrep.show: Show it to a DMV employee. We will also email this code to you.
appointmentPrep.details: For details about what you need to do to complete your application, visit the DMV website.

ballotByMail.mail: Ok, your ballot will now come by mail. You can still vote in-person at your polling place.
ballotByMail.inPerson: Ok, you vote in-person at your polling place.

organDonor.prompt: Do you wish to be an organ or tissue donor?
organDonor.validationMessage: You must mark Yes to maintain the donor dot on your driver license.
organDonor.messageYes: Answering Yes adds your name to the Donate Life California Organ and Tissue Donor Registry, and a pink “donor” dot will appear on your DL/ID card.
organDonor.messageNo: Answering No will not remove your name from the registry. If you wish to remove your name from the registry, you must contact Donate Life California. DMV can remove the pink dot from your DL/ID card, but cannot remove you from the registry.

monetaryContribution.prompt: Would you like to make a voluntary contribution of $2?
monetaryContribution.messageYes: Thank you for your donation! We will add this $2 to your total fee.

parentGuardianSignaturePage.Prompt: Because you are under 18, you will need a parent or guardian signature.
parentGuardianSignaturePage.explanation: If you have more than one parent or guardian with custody, both must sign.

methodSection.prompt: What would you like to do?

values.atDMV: My parent/guardian(s) will sign at the DMV

signatureSection.explanation: Your application will not be complete until your parent/guardian(s) signs.
signatureSection.liabilityStatement: I/We accept civil liability for this minor and understand a provisional permit issued to a minor is not valid until he/she begins driver training.

electronicSignatureSection.prompt: Please type your name and today’s date to electronically sign.

signatureSection.weNeedBasicInfo: We need some basic information about you.

parentGuardianSignaturePage.emancipatedInfoMessage: To prove you are an emancipated minor, you must declare your emancipation on a DL 11 form and provide proof of financial responsibility. For more information, refer to the DMV website.

summaryPage.prompt: Please take a minute to review your answers.

values: Housecar, 5th wheel over 15000 pounds, or livestock trailer (Class A)

tenYearHistoryPage.prompt: Have you ever been issued a driver license outside of California in the past ten years?
tenYearHistoryPage.explanation: This could be under the same or a different name, and to operate any type of motor vehicle.

fillOutHistoryVia.prompt: We need you to provide your driver license history for the past 10 years.
fillOutHistoryVia.explanation: How would you like to complete your 10 Year History Form?
fillOutHistoryVia.answerField: Get at a DMV field office

onlineForm.prompt: Please tell us about your previous license.

personalInformationSameQuestion.prompt: Is your personal information on this license the same as what is shown below?

personalInformationIsDifferent.prompt: What is your personal information as it was shown on this driver license?

additionalLicenses.prompt: Have you had additional driver licenses issued outside of California?
additionalLicenses.explanation: This could be under the same or a different name, and to operate any type of motor vehicle.

listOfLicenses.prompt: Below is a list of your licenses.

shared.declineToAnswerInformationRegistration: If you select Decline to answer, you will not be registered to vote.
shared.declineToAnswerInformationPreRegistratio: If you select Decline to answer, you will not be pre-registered to vote.

introductionPage.explanation:
Under state law, eligible citizens will be registered to vote unless they choose not to in this section.

If you’re already registered to vote, this service helps make sure your information is up to date.

If you need to register to vote before your DMV visit, you can register online at RegisterToVote.ca.gov.

citizenshipPage.pagePrompt: Are you a United States citizen?
citizenshipPage.faqQuestionWhatIfNotCitizen: What if I’m not a citizen?
citizenshipPage.faqAnswerWhatIfNotCitizen: If you are not a U.S. citizen, you are not eligible to register to vote.

eligibilityPage.pagePrompt: Do you meet ALL of the voter registration requirements listed below?
eligibilityPage.usCitizenshipStatement: I am a United States citizen
eligibilityPage.caCitizenshipStatement: I am a resident of California
eligibilityPage.ageStatement: I am at least 18 years old
eligibilityPage.convictionStatement: I am not currently in state or federal prison or on parole for the conviction of a felony
eligibilityPage.mentalCompetenceStatement: I am not currently found mentally incompetent to vote by a court
eligibilityPage.faqQuestionWhatIfDontMeetRequirements: What if I don’t meet all the requirements?
eligibilityPage.faqAnswerWhatIfDontMeetRequirements: If you don’t meet all the requirements, you are not eligible to register to vote.

optOutPage.answerNewRegistration: I want to register to vote.
optOutPage.answerUpdateRegistration: I am registered to vote and want to update my voter registration information.
optOutPage.answerOptOut: I do not want to register to vote or update my voter registration information.

preRegIntroductionPage.explanation:
Under state law, eligible citizens will be pre-registered to vote unless they choose not to in this section.

If you’re 16 or 17, you can pre-register today. Once you turn 18, you’re automatically registered to vote.

preRegCitizenshipPage.faqAnswerWhatIfNotCitizen: If you are not a U.S. citizen, you are not eligible to pre-register to vote.

preRegEligibilityPage.ageStatement: I am at least 16 or 17 years old
preRegEligibilityPage.faqQuestionHowDoesPreRegWork: How does pre-registering to vote work?
preRegEligibilityPage.faqAnswerHowDoesPreRegWork: To pre-register to vote in California, you must be 16 or 17 years old and meet all of the other eligibility requirements to vote. You will automatically be registered to vote on your 18th birthday.

preRegOptOutPage.answerNewRegistration: I want to pre-register to vote.
preRegOptOutPage.answerUpdateRegistration: I am pre-registered to vote and want to update my voter pre-registration information.
preRegOptOutPage.answerOptOut: I do not want to pre-register to vote or update my voter pre-registration information.

choosePartyPage.pagePrompt: Would you like to choose a political party preference?
choosePartyPage.explanation: If you do not choose a political party, you may not be able to vote for some parties’ candidates at a primary election for US President or central committee.
choosePartyPage.answerNo: I do not wish to choose a political party

chooseLanguagePage.pagePrompt: Choose a language for your election materials.

byMailPage.pagePrompt: Would you like to get your ballot by mail before each election?
byMailPage.explanation: If you answer Yes, you can still vote in-person.

contactInfoPage.pagePrompt: Would you like to receive election information via email or text?

confirmation.pagePrompt: Thank you, your voter registration application will be processed when you complete your business at the DMV.
confirmation.explanation:
If you do not receive a voter notification card within four weeks after your visit to the DMV, contact your county elections official.

You can check your voter registration status with the California Secretary of State at voterstatus.sos.ca.gov.

updateChoosePartyPage.explanation:
If you do not choose a political party, you may not be able to vote for some parties’ candidates at a primary election for US President or central committee.

This will overwrite your previous political party preference.

updateContactInfoPage.explanation: Answering No will also remove any previous contact information.

preferencesIntroPage.pagePrompt: Next you will choose your voter preferences.
preferencesIntroPage.languageExplanation: Choose a language for your election materials.
preferencesIntroPage.byMailExplanation: Receive your ballot in the mail for all future elections, meaning you don’t have to go to a polling place to vote.
preferencesIntroPage.contactInfoExplanation: Provide your contact information if you want election officials to contact you about election and voter information.

preferencesUpdateIntroPage.pagePrompt: Next we’d like to quickly make sure your voter registration is up to date.
preferencesUpdateIntroPage.explanation: This will replace your previous voter preferences.

shared.contactDMV:
Please contact the DMV if you have further questions.

Telephone: 1-800-777-0133

Hearing Impaired: TTY 1-800-368-4327
